results.title: Mates, martyrs and masters
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: A training film aimed at developing management skills. Tom, the “Mate” has difficulty accepting leadership responsibilities and fails to provide firmness and direction to his work group. Harriet, the “Martyr” is constantly snowed under with work because she is disorganised and fails to delegate work to her staff. Rick, the “Master” avoids risks for fear of making mistakes. Dr. Warren Burrows, Motivation Specialist, assists in examining and improving their management skills. Made in association with the Victorian Film Corporation and the Australian Film Commission.

results.title: Materials handling methods
results.brief_description: Shows methods of handling materials in large warehouses and unloading bulky equipment. Illustrates the special applications of two-wheel trucks, four-wheel trucks, dolly trucks, hand-lift trucks, fork lifts, tractor trailers, belt conveyors and straddle trucks.

results.title: Match de Prestidigitation
results.brief_description: A magician divides himself into two people, who then perform tricks before transforming back into one person, in one of Georges Méliès’ early trick films that pioneered special effects.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.title: Masters of modern sculpture. 3. New world
results.brief_description: Shows the influence of the European artists who came to New York with the end of World War II. Illustrates how they began to use all types of materials including wood, iron, steel, plastic, stone and plaster. Works include those by David Smith, John Chamberlain, Isamo Noguchi, Claus Oldenburg, and Christo. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Mastering change: video workbook [text]
results.brief_description: Change occurs in all the areas of our lives and cannot be avoided. This workbook, which accompanies the video set looks at skills which can be developed to successfully cope with and make the most of change.
